methods: Distributive law for lists and distributions
title: Multisets and Distributions
abstract: We give a lightweight alternative construction of Jacobs's distributive law for multisets and distributions that does not involve any combinatorics. We first give a distributive law for lists and distributions, then apply a general theorem on 2-categories that allows properties of lists to be transferred automatically to multisets. The theorem states that equations between 2-cells are preserved by epic 2-natural transformations. In our application, the appropriate epic 2-natural transformation is defined in terms of the Parikh map, familiar from formal language theory, that takes a list to its multiset of elements.
